sentence.Network_en: I feel like a real drudge — I've done nothing but clean all day!
sentence.Network_cn: 我觉得自己像个做苦工的——整天都在做清洁工作!

sentence.Network_en: I am a disappointed drudge, sir.
sentence.Network_cn: 我是个绝望了的苦力, 先生.

sentence.Network_en: Who, on a Sunday jaunt to the shore or mountains, has not pitied some self - employed drudge?
sentence.Network_cn: 哪一个星期天到海滨或山上去游览的人不同情那些辛辛苦苦的个体经营者 呢 ?

list.abs: the professor is drudging at dictionary-compiling .教授正在辛苦地编字典。
I said that professional writers are solitary drudges who seldom see other writers ., 我说职业作家是很少能见到其他作家的孤家寡人.
I feel like a real drudge — I've done nothing but clean all day !我觉得自己像个做苦工的——整天都在做清洁工作!
Mr. Quiverful was an honest , painstaking , drudging man ., 奎瓦富先生是一个诚实正派 , 刻苦耐劳的人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a noun): of unknown origin; perhaps related to drag

entry.def: If you describe someone as a drudge, you mean they have to work hard at a job which is not very important or interesting.

means.word_mean: 1. one who works hard at boring tasks
2. a laborer who is obliged to do menial work

sentences.sentence: "She was digging away at her math homework"
